BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN
PSYCHOLOGY
LEVEL 1
AREA VIII
PHYSICAL PLANT AND
FACILITIES
A. CAMPUS

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.1.There is a Site Development
Plan, and program of
implementation.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.2 The Campus has accessible
good roads and pathways.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.3 The campus is in a well-
planned, clean and properly
landscaped environment.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.4 There is a system to ensure that all of
the following are provided:
S.4.1. Traffic safety in and outside
the campus;
S.4.2. waste management program;
S.4.3. proper utilization, repair
and upkeep of school facilities
and equipment; and
S.4.4. cleanliness and orderliness of
the school campus.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.5. An area for outdoor
educational activities, e.g.
social, physical, athletic,
cultural, military training,
etc. exists.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.6.There is a campus
security unit that ensures
safety of the academic
community.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.1. The site Infrastructure
development plan is
implemented as planned.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.2. The site plan is
strategically displayed
inside the campus
indicating the location of
the different buildings,
driveways, parking areas,
etc.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.3. The infrastructure
development plan is
implemented in
accordance with approved
zoning ordinances.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.4. Covered walks are
provided to protect the
academic community
from inclement weather.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.5. The institution
implements a Waste
Management Program.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.6. The Maintenance Unit or
its equivalent periodically
inspects school facilities
and equipment to ensure
their proper utilization
and upkeep.

OUTCOME/S
O.1. The Campus environment
is conducive to all
educational activities.

OUTCOME/S
O.2. The site can accommodate
its present school
population and future
expansion.

OUTCOME/S
O.3. The campus is safe and
well-maintained.

OUTCOME/S
O.4. The campus is well-
planned, clean and properly
landscaped.

BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN
PSYCHOLOGY
LEVEL 1
AREA VIII
PHYSICAL PLANT AND
FACILITIES
B. BUILDINGS

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.1. The buildings meet all
requirements of the
Building Code. A
Certificate of Occupancy
for each building is
conspicuously displayed.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.2. The buildings are
constructed according to
their respective uses.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.3. The buildings are well-
planned and appropriately
located to provide for
future expansion.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.4. Entry and exit points
permit the use of the
buildings for public and
other functions with
minimum interference to
school activities.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.5. Emergency exits are
provided and properly
marked.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.6. The buildings are
equipped with
emergency/fire escapes
which are readily accessible.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.7. The corridors, doorways,
and alleys are well-
constructed for better
mobility.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.8. The buildings are well-
ventilated and lighted.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S9. The buildings have
facilities for persons with
disability (PWDs) as
provided by law.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.10.There is a central signal
and fire alarm system.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.11.There are readily
accessible and functional
fire extinguishers and other
fire-fighting equipment.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.12.Bulletin boards, display
boards, waste disposal
containers and other
amenities are strategically
located inside the buildings.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.13.There are faculty rooms
and offices.

SYSTEM-INPUTS AND
PROCESSES
S.14.The buildings are insured.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.1. The buildings are clean,
well-maintaineo and free
from vandalistfc acts.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.2. Toilets are clean and well-
maintained.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.3. Electrical lines are safely
installed and periodically
checked.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.4. Water facilities are
functional and well-
distributed in all buildings.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.5. There is a periodic
potability testing of
drinking water.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.6. Floor plans indicating fire
exits and location of fire-
fighting equipment, stand
pipes, and other water
sources are conspicuously
displayed in each building.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.7. All school facilities are
periodically subjected to
pest control and
inspection.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.8. Smoking is strictly
prohibited inside the
campus.

OUTCOME/S
O.1. The buildings and other
facilities are safe, well-
maintained and
functional.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.1. The housing facilities are
functionally designed.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.2. The housing facilities
and surroundings are
properly maintained and
monitored.

IMPLEMENTATION
I.3. The IRR on housing
services is strictly followed
(e.g. dormitory fees, etc.)

IMPLEMENTATION
I.4. The institution
coordinates with LGU‘s
and owner's of private
boarding houses.

OUTCOME/S
O.1. The housing facilities
are safe, habitable and
well-maintained.

OUTCOME/S
O.2. There is wholesome
coordination among the
Institution, the LGU’s and
the owners of private
boarding houses.
